problem_text: If \frac { I J } { X J } = \frac { H J } { Y J }, m \angle W X J = 130 and m \angle W Z G = 20, find m \angle J.
logic_forms: Equals(RatioOf(LengthOf(Line(I, J)), LengthOf(Line(X, J))), RatioOf(LengthOf(Line(H, J)), LengthOf(Line(Y, J))))
proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: ∠XHZ, XY, ∠CZA, pi * (20 / 180) = ∠GZW, ∠JYA, G on CZ, ∠ZXJ, X on AY, HZ, ∠YXJ, ∠XJY, H on CZ, ∠JXW, ∠CZX, H on JX, JY, ∠IYA, H on GI, JX, ∠GHX, ∠JHG, Y on XZ, ∠ZHJ, X on AZ, W on AZ, I on JY, ∠IHJ, 3.14 = pi, ∠ZXH, HX, I on HZ, ∠XHI, pi * (130 / 180) = ∠JXW, ∠CZW, ∠XJI, HJ / JY = IJ / JX, XZ

Step 2:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on CZ, ∠CZA
Conclusions: ∠CZA = ∠GZA

Step 3:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠JYA, X on AY
Conclusions: ∠JYA = ∠JYX

Step 4:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠JXW, ∠ZXJ
Conclusions: pi = ∠JXW + ∠ZXJ

Step 5:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : H on CZ, ∠CZX
Conclusions: ∠CZX = ∠HZX

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠YXJ, H on JX
Conclusions: ∠YXH = ∠YXJ

Step 7:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : X on AY, ∠IYA
Conclusions: ∠IYA = ∠IYX

Step 8:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : H on GI, H on JX
Conclusions: ∠GHX = ∠IHJ, ∠JHG = ∠XHI

Step 9:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : JX, JY, XY
Conclusions: △JXY

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠ZXJ, Y on XZ
Conclusions: ∠YXJ = ∠ZXJ

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CZA, X on AZ
Conclusions: ∠CZA = ∠CZX

Step 12:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : W on AZ, ∠CZA
Conclusions: ∠CZA = ∠CZW

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠JYA, I on JY
Conclusions: ∠IYA = ∠JYA

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on JY, ∠XJY
Conclusions: ∠XJI = ∠XJY

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠ZXH, Y on XZ
Conclusions: ∠YXH = ∠ZXH

Step 16:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on HZ, ∠ZHJ
Conclusions: ∠IHJ = ∠ZHJ

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : I on HZ, ∠XHZ
Conclusions: ∠XHI = ∠XHZ

Step 18:
Theorem: Circumference Split
Premises : ∠GHX, ∠XHI, ∠IHJ, ∠JHG
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠GHX + ∠IHJ + ∠JHG + ∠XHI

Step 19:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on CZ, ∠CZW
Conclusions: ∠CZW = ∠GZW

Step 20:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : H on JX, ∠XJI
Conclusions: ∠HJI = ∠XJI

Step 21:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : XZ, HZ, HX
Conclusions: △HXZ

Step 22:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(Y, X, J)
Premises : △JXY
Conclusions: pi = ∠JYX + ∠XJY + ∠YXJ

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CZA = ∠CZX, ∠CZA = ∠GZA
Conclusions: ∠CZX = ∠GZA

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CZA = ∠GZA, ∠CZA = ∠CZW
Conclusions: ∠CZW = ∠GZA

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IYA = ∠IYX, ∠IYA = ∠JYA
Conclusions: ∠IYX = ∠JYA

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠YXH = ∠ZXH, ∠YXH = ∠YXJ
Conclusions: ∠YXJ = ∠ZXH

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GHX = ∠IHJ, ∠IHJ = ∠ZHJ
Conclusions: ∠GHX = ∠ZHJ

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JHG = ∠XHI, ∠XHI = ∠XHZ
Conclusions: ∠JHG = ∠XHZ

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HJI = ∠XJI, ∠XJI = ∠XJY
Conclusions: ∠HJI = ∠XJY

Step 30:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(Z, X, H)
Premises : △HXZ
Conclusions: pi = ∠HZX + ∠XHZ + ∠ZXH

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CZW = ∠GZA, ∠CZW = ∠GZW, pi * (20 / 180) = ∠GZW
Conclusions: pi * (20 / 180) = ∠GZA

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IYX = ∠JYA, ∠JYA = ∠JYX
Conclusions: ∠IYX = ∠JYX

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠YXJ = ∠ZXH, ∠YXJ = ∠ZXJ
Conclusions: ∠ZXH = ∠ZXJ

Step 34:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 2 * pi = ∠GHX + ∠IHJ + ∠JHG + ∠XHI, ∠XHI = ∠XHZ, ∠JHG = ∠XHZ, 3.14 = pi, ∠IHJ = ∠ZHJ, ∠GHX = ∠ZHJ
Conclusions: 2 * 3.14 = ∠XHZ + ∠XHZ + ∠ZHJ + ∠ZHJ

Step 35:
Theorem: Side-Angle-Side Similarity Theorem
Premises : ∠HJI = ∠XJY, HJ / JY = IJ / JX
Conclusions: △HIJ ~ △YXJ

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CZX = ∠GZA, pi * (20 / 180) = ∠GZA
Conclusions: pi * (20 / 180) = ∠CZX

Step 37:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠IYX = ∠JYX, pi = ∠JYX + ∠XJY + ∠YXJ, ∠YXJ = ∠ZXH
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠IYX + ∠XJY + ∠ZXH

Step 38:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠ZXH = ∠ZXJ, pi * (130 / 180) = ∠JXW, pi = ∠JXW + ∠ZXJ
Conclusions: 3.14 = 3.14 * (130 / 180) + ∠ZXH

Step 39:
Theorem: Similar Definition
Premises : △HIJ ~ △YXJ
Conclusions: ∠HJI = ∠XJY, ∠IHJ = ∠JYX

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CZX = ∠HZX, pi * (20 / 180) = ∠CZX
Conclusions: pi * (20 / 180) = ∠HZX

Step 41:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * (20 / 180) = ∠HZX, pi = ∠HZX + ∠XHZ + ∠ZXH
Conclusions: 3.14 = 3.14 * (20 / 180) + ∠XHZ + ∠ZXH

Step 42:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = 3.14 * (20 / 180) + ∠XHZ + ∠ZXH, 3.14 = 3.14 * (130 / 180) + ∠ZXH, ∠IHJ = ∠ZHJ, 2 * 3.14 = ∠XHZ + ∠XHZ + ∠ZHJ + ∠ZHJ
Conclusions: 1.22 = ∠IHJ

Step 43:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IYX = ∠JYX, 1.22 = ∠IHJ, ∠IHJ = ∠JYX
Conclusions: 1.22 = ∠IYX

Step 44:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = ∠IYX + ∠XJY + ∠ZXH, 3.14 = 3.14 * (130 / 180) + ∠ZXH, 1.22 = ∠IYX
Conclusions: 1.05 = ∠XJY
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(RatioOf(LengthOf(Line(I, J)), LengthOf(Line(X, J))), RatioOf(LengthOf(Line(H, J)), LengthOf(Line(Y, J))))
